titleStmt.title: Edward Bissell to James W. Tate
CWG7968

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives

creation.placeName: New York City, New York County, New York

body.p:
New York
13th April 1863
To
James W. Tate Esq
Asst Secy of State
Frankfort Kentucky --
Dear Sir,

Your Letter of the 8th inst relative to the renewal of my Commission as Kentucky Commissioner of Deeds &c in this City or my re-appointment, as such is just received, and in answer thereto_ I ask most respectfully to be re-appointed and that my new Commission may be now transmitted to me, to date from & commence running on the day after the date of my present Commission -- which will as you state expire on May 19/63.

Agreeably with your request Sir I herewith inclose & transmit to you, the required lawful fee of Five dollars in this case made & provided: -- Be kind enough Sir to send my Commission, acknowledge your due recepit of above named Fee as soon as practicable. So that I may take & send out my new oath of Office, and have all "OTC" before my old Commission expires --

Very Respectfully Sir -- Your Obedt Svt
Edward Bissell
No 271 Broadway New York City

New York
Comr of Deeds
Edwd Bissell
N. Y. City
Com Issd May 1. 1863.
